RefParameter.Name: CubeProgrammer_Minimal_Version
RefParameter.Comment: This is the minimal CubeProgrammer version for the concerned MPU package

RefParameter.Name: DDR_Start_Address
RefParameter.Comment: This is the base address for DDR subsystem in the specific MPU packages considered

RefParameter.Name: DDR_Frequency
RefParameter.Description: DDR subsystem frequency. This value is copied from the Clock Configuration panel

RefParameter.Name: DDR_Frequency
RefParameter.Description: DDR subsystem frequency. This value is copied from the Clock Configuration panel

RefParameter.Name: ADDRESS_MAPPING
RefParameter.Description: DDR Address mapping can be configured in RBC (Row-Bank-Column) or BRC (Bank-Row-Column)

RefParameter.Name: RELAXED_TIMING_MODE
RefParameter.Description:
Add one supplementary clock cycle to some key DDR parameters.
This ease the DDR bring-up by relaxing some key timings.
The relaxed timing parameters are: tRC, tRCD and tRP.
The +1 is made before register computation, thus not visible in the parameter edition interface

RefParameter.Name: TEMPERATURE_OVER_85C
RefParameter.Description: DDR3 only, when TC > 85 TREFI = 3.9 and ASR = 1

RefParameter.Name: IMPEDANCE_DURING_READ
RefParameter.Description: Changing Output impedance (DDR) and ODT (PHY) for read Operations.

RefParameter.Name: IMPEDANCE_DURING_READ
RefParameter.Description: Changing Output impedance (DDR) for read Operations.

RefParameter.Name: IMPEDANCE_DURING_WRITE
RefParameter.Description: Changing Output impedance (PHY) and ODT (DDR) for write Operations.

RefParameter.Name: IMPEDANCE_DURING_WRITE
RefParameter.Description: Changing Output impedance (PHY) for write Operations.

RefParameter.Name: SPEED_BIN_GRADE
RefParameter.Description:
JEDEC Standard for DDR3 SDRAM.
Set value of each timings from JEDEC standard for this 'Speed Bin Grade' selection.
Tick 'Show Advanced Parameters' to see the involved timings.

Select Speed Bin / Grade combination according to the DDR you have provisioned.
In case your Speed Bin / Grade is not listed, please use:
"1066G / 8-8-8â as a relaxed configuration that should work with most of DDRs.
"1066E / 6-6-6â if you have faster DDR Speed Bin / Gradeâ

RefParameter.Name: SCHEDULING_AND_QOS

PossibleValue.Comment: CONFIG 2: 2 port QoS (expired VPR/VPW for RT)
CONFIG 3: 2 port QoS (expired VPR/VPW for RT, lowered timeout)
CONFIG 4: 2 port QoS + with port aging
CONFIG 5: 2 port, low power scheduling, page close policy

RefParameter.Description:
Allows to choose the best scheduling and Quality of Service configuration for the targeted project.
The various configurations possible are:
- CONFIG 0: 1 port + No VPR/VPW + antistarvation
- CONFIG 1: 2 ports + No VPR/VPW + antistarvation
- CONFIG 2: 2 ports + QoS VPR/VPW + antistarvation
- CONFIG 3: 2 ports + QoS VPR/VPW + timeout + antistarvation
- CONFIG 4: 2 ports + QoS VPR/VPW + timeout + antistarvation
- CONFIG 5: 1 port + intelligent percharge + No VPR/VPW + antistarvation

RefParameter.Name: BL
RefParameter.Description:
Burst Length (BL) is variable for LPDDR2. Fixed for other DDR types.
Possible values are 4, 8 and 16.

RefParameter.Name: BL
RefParameter.Description: Burst Length (BL) is fixed for DDR3, it can not be changed

RefParameter.Name: BL
RefParameter.Description: Burst Length (BL) is fixed for LPDDR3, it can not be changed

RefParameter.Name: CL
RefParameter.Description: The number of cycles between sending a column address to the memory and the beginning of the data in response. This is the number of cycles it takes to read the first bit of memory from a DRAM with the correct row already open. Unlike the other numbers, this is not a maximum, but an exact number that must be agreed on between the memory controller and the memory

RefParameter.Name: CWL
RefParameter.Description: "CAS Write Latency is the delay, in clock cycles, between the internal Write command and the availability of the first bit of input data.

RefParameter.Name: tRAS
RefParameter.Description: ACT to PRE command period the minimum number of clock cycles required between a row active command and issuing the precharge command. This is the time needed to internally refresh the row, and overlaps with TRCD. In SDRAM modules, it is simply TRCD + CL. Otherwise, approximately equal to TRCD + 2ÃCL.

RefParameter.Name: tRAS
RefParameter.Description: ACT to PRE command period the minimum number of clock cycles required between a row active command and issuing the precharge command. This is the time needed to internally refresh the row, and overlaps with TRCD. In SDRAM modules, it is simply TRCD + CL. Otherwise, approximately equal to TRCD + 2ÃCL.

RefParameter.Name: tMRD
RefParameter.Comment: MODE REGISTER SET command cycle time (tMRD)
RefParameter.Description: Mode Register Set command cycle time

RefParameter.Name: tMRD
RefParameter.Comment: MODE REGISTER SET command cycle time (tMRD)
RefParameter.Description: MODE REGISTER SET command delay (MRW command to non-MRW command interval)

RefParameter.Name: tMOD
RefParameter.Comment: MODE REGISTER SET command update delay (tMOD)
RefParameter.Description: Mode Register Set command update delay

RefParameter.Name: tRCD
RefParameter.Comment: Row Address to column Address Delay (tRCD)
RefParameter.Description: Activate to Read/Write command period: the minimum number of clock cycles required between opening a row of memory and accessing columns within it. The time to read the first bit of memory from a DRAM without an active row is TRCD + CL

RefParameter.Name: tRCD
RefParameter.Comment: Row Address to column Address Delay (tRCD)
RefParameter.Description: Activate to Read/Write command period: the minimum number of clock cycles required between opening a row of memory and accessing columns within it. The time to read the first bit of memory from a DRAM without an active row is TRCD + CL

RefParameter.Name: tRCD
RefParameter.Comment: Row Address to column Address Delay (tRCD)
RefParameter.Description: Activate to Read/Write command period: the minimum number of clock cycles required between opening a row of memory and accessing columns within it. The time to read the first bit of memory from a DRAM without an active row is TRCD + CL

RefParameter.Name: tRP
RefParameter.Description: PRE command period: the minimum number of clock cycles required between issuing the precharge command and opening the next row. The time to read the first bit of memory from a DRAM with the wrong row open is TRP + TRCD + CL

RefParameter.Name: tRPab
RefParameter.Description: Row Precharge Time (all banks)

RefParameter.Name: WL
RefParameter.Description: The Write Latency is defined from the rising edge of the clock on which the Write Command is issued to the rising edge of the clock from which the tDQSS delay is measured.

RefParameter.Name: WL
RefParameter.Description: The Write Latency is defined from the rising edge of the clock on which the Write Command is issued to the rising edge of the clock from which the tDQSS delay is measured.

RefParameter.Name: tWR
RefParameter.Description: Write to Precharge Delay / Write Recovery Time or tWR: This sets the number of clock cycles between the completion of a valid write operation and before an active bank can be precharged. Write to precharge formula is tCL -1 +(Burst Legnth / 2)+tWTR

RefParameter.Name: tCCD
RefParameter.Description: CAS# to CAS#, min between 2 READ or 2 WRITE (burst canâtbe interrupted with DDR3)

RefParameter.Name: tCCD
RefParameter.Description: CAS# to CAS#, min between 2 READ or 2 WRITE . READ may be interrupted by read and write by write

RefParameter.Name: tMRW
RefParameter.Description: MR write command period

RefParameter.Name: tMRW
RefParameter.Description: MR write command period

RefParameter.Name: tMRR
RefParameter.Description: MR read command period

RefParameter.Name: tMRR
RefParameter.Description: MR read command period

RefParameter.Name: tRRD
RefParameter.Description: Activate to Activate delay or tRRD: Number of clock cycles between the activation of two rows in different banks of the same rank. (not much of a performance boost)

RefParameter.Name: tRRD
RefParameter.Description: Activate to Activate delay or tRRD: Number of clock cycles between the activation of two rows in different banks of the same rank. (not much of a performance boost)

RefParameter.Name: tCKSRX
RefParameter.Comment: Min clocks before self refresh exit (tCKSRX)
RefParameter.Description: Valid Clock Requirement before Self Refresh Exit (SRX) or Power-Down Exit (PDX) or Reset Exit

RefParameter.Name: tCKSRE
RefParameter.Comment: Min clocks after self refresh entry (tCKSRE)
RefParameter.Description: Valid Clock Requirement after Self Refresh Entry (SRE) or Power-Down Entry (PDE)

RefParameter.Name: tCKE
RefParameter.Comment: Min number of CKE high/low during Self Refresh and Power Down (tCKE)
RefParameter.Description: CKE minimum pulse width

RefParameter.Name: tCKE
RefParameter.Comment: Min number of CKE high/low during Self Refresh and Power Down (tCKE)
RefParameter.Description: CKE min. pulse width (high and low pulse width)

RefParameter.Name: tCKESR
RefParameter.Comment: Min CKE low between during SR (tCKESR)
RefParameter.Description: CKE minimum pulse width during SELF REFRESH (low pulse width during SELF REFRESH)

RefParameter.Name: tCKESR
RefParameter.Comment: Min CKE low between during SR (tCKESR)
RefParameter.Description: CKE minimum pulse width during SELF REFRESH (low pulse width during SELF REFRESH)

RefParameter.Name: tXP
RefParameter.Description: Exit Power Down with DLL on to any valid command; Exit Precharge Power Down with DLL frozen to commands not requiring a locked DLL

RefParameter.Name: tXP
RefParameter.Description: Exit Power Down with DLL on to any valid command; Exit Precharge Power Down with DLL frozen to commands not requiring a locked DLL

RefParameter.Name: tXP
RefParameter.Description: Exit Power Down with DLL on to any valid command; Exit Precharge Power Down with DLL frozen to commands not requiring a locked DLL

RefParameter.Name: tDQSCKmax
RefParameter.Description: DQS, DQS# rising edge output access time from rising CK, CK# - max value

RefParameter.Name: tDQSCKmin
RefParameter.Description: DQS, DQS# rising edge output access time from rising CK, CK# - min value

RefParameter.Name: tXPDLL
RefParameter.Description: Exit Precharge Power Down with DLL frozen to commands requiring a locked DLL

RefParameter.Name: tRFC
RefParameter.Description: Refresh to Activate Delay / Refresh Cycle Time or tRFC: Sets the number of clock cycles from the refresh command until the first activate command to the same rank.

RefParameter.Name: tRFCab
RefParameter.Description: Minimum time from refresh to refresh or activate, if using all-bank refreshes

RefParameter.Name: tRFCab
RefParameter.Description: Minimum time from refresh to refresh or activate, if using all-bank refreshes

RefParameter.Name: tXS
RefParameter.Comment: Exit SR to CMD not requiring locked DLL: = max(5 clk , tRFC +10ns) (tXS)
RefParameter.Description: Exit SR to CMD not requiring locked DLL: = max(5 clk , tRFC +10ns)

RefParameter.Name: tXSDLL
RefParameter.Comment: Exit self refresh to commands requiring a locked DLL (tXSDLL)
RefParameter.Description: Exit Self Refresh to commands requiring a locked DLL

RefParameter.Name: RL
RefParameter.Description: The Read Latency is defined from the rising edge of the clock on which the Read Command is issued to the rising edge of the clock from which the tDQSCK delay is measured.

RefParameter.Name: RL
RefParameter.Description: The Read Latency is defined from the rising edge of the clock on which the Read Command is issued to the rising edge of the clock from which the tDQSCK delay is measured.

RefParameter.Name: wr2pre
RefParameter.Comment: Min WR to PRE in same bank (wr2pre)

RefParameter.Name: wr2pre
RefParameter.Comment: Min WR to PRE in same bank (wr2pre)

RefParameter.Name: wr2rd
RefParameter.Comment: Min write CMD to read CMD (wr2rd)

RefParameter.Name: wr2rd
RefParameter.Comment: Min write CMD to read CMD (wr2rd)

RefParameter.Name: rd2wr
RefParameter.Comment: Min read CMD to write CMD (rd2wr)

RefParameter.Name: rd2wr
RefParameter.Comment: Min write CMD to read CMD (rd2wr)

RefParameter.Name: t_rc
RefParameter.Comment: Min between activate to same ban (t_rc), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: t_rc
RefParameter.Comment: Min between activate to same bank (t_rc), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: t_mrw
RefParameter.Comment: Time to wait after MRW or MRR (t_mrw)

RefParameter.Name: t_mrw
RefParameter.Comment: Time to wait after MRW or MRR (t_mrw)

RefParameter.Name: t_mod
RefParameter.Comment: Load mode to non load mode (t_mod)

RefParameter.Name: t_mrd
RefParameter.Comment: Mode Register Set to Mode Register Set (t_mrd)

RefParameter.Name: t_mrd
RefParameter.Comment: Mode Register Set to Mode Register Set (t_mrd)

RefParameter.Name: t_mrd
RefParameter.Comment: Mode Register Set to Mode Register Set (t_mrd)

RefParameter.Name: t_rcd
RefParameter.Comment: Mode Register Set to Mode Register Set (t_rcd), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: t_rcd
RefParameter.Comment: Mode Register Set to Mode Register Set (t_rcd), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: t_rcd
RefParameter.Comment: Mode Register Set to Mode Register Set (t_rcd), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: tFAW
RefParameter.Description: Four Activate Window or tFAW: The number of cycles in which four activates are allowed within the same rank.

RefParameter.Name: tFAW
RefParameter.Description: Four Activate Window or tFAW: The number of cycles in which four activates are allowed within the same rank.

RefParameter.Name: tRASmax
RefParameter.Comment: Max between ACT and PRE to same bank in 1024 clk (tRASmax)
RefParameter.Description: Max between ACT and PRE to same bank in 1024 clk: 9 *tREFI

RefParameter.Name: tRTP
RefParameter.Description: Read to Precharge delay or tRTP: The number of clock cycles between a read command to a row pre-charge command of the same rank.

RefParameter.Name: tRTP
RefParameter.Description: Read to Precharge delay or tRTP: The number of clock cycles between a read command to a row pre-charge command of the same rank.

RefParameter.Name: tRC
RefParameter.Description: Row Cycle Time or tRC:This sets the number of cpu cycles a memory row (Remeber that memory is devided into "cells" much like an excel spredsheet) takes to complete a full cycle. A full cycle is from row activation to precharging of the active row. This setting has major affect on memory speed w/ a lower timing being faster. tRC= tras + tRP

RefParameter.Name: tRC
RefParameter.Description: Row Cycle Time or tRC:This sets the number of cpu cycles a memory row (Remeber that memory is devided into "cells" much like an excel spredsheet) takes to complete a full cycle. A full cycle is from row activation to precharging of the active row. This setting has major affect on memory speed w/ a lower timing being faster. tRC= tras + tRP

RefParameter.Name: tREFI
RefParameter.Description:
Refresh Mode Select / Refresh Period or tREFi: Sets the number of clock cycles refreshes.
3,9us (DDR TcMax above 85Â°C) or 7,8us (DDR TcMax 85Â°C).

RefParameter.Name: tREFI
RefParameter.Description:
Refresh Mode Select / Refresh Period or tREFi: Sets the number of clock cycles refreshes will be executed.
Possible values are 3,9us and 7,8us.

RefParameter.Name: tWTR
RefParameter.Description: RDelay from start of internal write transaction to internal read command

RefParameter.Name: tWTR
RefParameter.Description: RDelay from start of internal write transaction to internal read command

RefParameter.Name: t_ras_max
RefParameter.Comment: Max between ACT and PRE to same bank in 1024 clk (t_ras_max)

RefParameter.Name: t_ras_max
RefParameter.Comment: Max between ACT and PRE to same bank in 1024 clk (t_ras_max)

RefParameter.Name: t_rd2pre
RefParameter.Comment: Min RD to PRE in same bank (t_rd2pre)

RefParameter.Name: t_rd2pre
RefParameter.Comment: Min RD to PRE in same bank (t_rd2pre)

RefParameter.Name: t_rd2pre
RefParameter.Comment: Min RD to PRE in same bank (t_rd2pre)

RefParameter.Name: t_rp
RefParameter.Comment: PRECHARGE command period (t_rp), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: t_rp
RefParameter.Comment: PRECHARGE command period (t_rp), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: t_cksrx
RefParameter.Comment: Min clock stable before self refresh exit (t_cksrx)

RefParameter.Comment: Min CKE low SR / Power down (t_ckesr)

RefParameter.Comment: Clock stable time before next command after Clock Stop Exit (t_ckcsx)

RefParameter.Comment: Exit self refresh to any command (t_xsr)

RefParameter.Comment: Cycle to hold ODT for Write, min 2 recommended (wr_odt_hold)

RefParameter.Comment: Cycle to hold ODT for Write, min 2 recommended (wr_odt_hold)

RefParameter.Comment: ODT delay should be set to 0 for DDR3 (wr_odt_delay)

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_rddata_en
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clocks from DFI read to readdata_en (RL-2) (dfi_t_rddata_en)

RefParameter.Comment: Num of clocks from DFI write to wrdata_en (WL-1) (dfi_tphy_wrlat)

RefParameter.Comment: CAS#-to-CAS# command delay (tccd), this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Comment: trc, this parameter can be relaxed

RefParameter.Name: tINIT4_5
RefParameter.Comment: from Reset to end of Initialization (tINIT4_5)

RefParameter.Name: mr_data
RefParameter.Comment: Mode register addr/data for LP and data for non LP

RefParameter.Name: derate_byte
RefParameter.Comment: Which byte of MRR is used for derating

RefParameter.Name: en_dfi_dram_clk_disable
RefParameter.Comment: Assertion of clk disable to DFI

RefParameter.Name: deeppowerdown_en
RefParameter.Comment: Goes into DPD after number of idle cycle

RefParameter.Name: powerdown_en
RefParameter.Comment: Goes into PDN after number of idle cycle

RefParameter.Name: selfref_en
RefParameter.Comment: Goes into SR after number of idle cycle

RefParameter.Name: hw_lp_exit_idle_x32
RefParameter.Comment: Active driven low after x clocks

RefParameter.Name: hw_lp_exit_idle_en
RefParameter.Comment: Enable exit from automatic PDN, SR modes

RefParameter.Name: refresh_burst
RefParameter.Comment: Number of refresh allowed to accumulate

RefParameter.Name: refresh_update_level
RefParameter.Comment: Toggle this bit after update the Refresh registers!

RefParameter.Name: dfi_alert_err_int_en
RefParameter.Comment: Interrupt enable for DFI alert error

RefParameter.Name: dis_srx_zqcl
RefParameter.Comment: Disable issuing of ZQCL after SRX

RefParameter.Name: zq_resistor_shared
RefParameter.Comment: ZQ is not shared between ranks

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_ctrl_delay
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clocks for command bus from DFI to DDR

RefParameter.Name: dfi_tphy_wrdata
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clocks from DFI wrdata_en to wrdata on DFI

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_wrdata_delay
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clk from dfi_wrdata_en to data on DRAM

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_dram_clk_disable
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clk from dfi_dram_clk disable to DDR clk disable

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_dram_clk_enable
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clk from dfi_dram_clk disable to DDR clk valid

RefParameter.Name: dfi_tlp_resp
RefParameter.Comment: tfi_resp time for pdn, sr, dpd

RefParameter.Name: dfi_lp_wakeup_dpd
RefParameter.Comment: Value to drive on dfi_lp_wakeup when dpd: 16 cycles

RefParameter.Name: dfi_lp_wakeup_sr
RefParameter.Comment: Value to drive on dfi_lp_wakeup when selfref entered: 16 cycles

RefParameter.Name: dfi_lp_wakeup_pd
RefParameter.Comment: Value to drive on dfi_lp_wakeup on pdn: 16 cycles

RefParameter.Name: dfi_lp_en_pd
RefParameter.Comment: Enable DFI LPI during power down entry /exit

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_ctrlup_max
RefParameter.Comment: Max num of clocks that dfi_ctrlupd must be asserted

RefParameter.Name: dfi_t_ctrlup_min
RefParameter.Comment: Min num of clocks that dfi_ctrlupd must be asserted

RefParameter.Name: dfi_phyupd_en
RefParameter.Comment: Enable ack of PHY initiated updates

RefParameter.Name: rank0_rd_odt
RefParameter.Comment: ODT's on during read from rank0, should be 0

RefParameter.Name: rank0_wr_odt
RefParameter.Comment: ODT's on during write to rank0

RefParameter.Name: rank0_wr_odt
RefParameter.Comment: ODT's on during write to rank0

RefParameter.Name: rdwr_idle_gap
RefParameter.Comment: Switch time gap between transaction stores

RefParameter.Name: lpr_num_entries
RefParameter.Comment: Num of entries in LP stores

RefParameter.Name: prefer_write
RefParameter.Comment: Bank selector prefer write to read

RefParameter.Name: force_low_pri_n
RefParameter.Comment: Active low to force incoming to LP

RefParameter.Name: hpr_xact_run_length
RefParameter.Comment: Num of transaction serviced once HPR goes critical

RefParameter.Name: hpr_max_starve
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clocks before the starved HPR goes critical

RefParameter.Name: lpr_xact_run_length
RefParameter.Comment: Num of transaction serviced once LPR goes critical

RefParameter.Name: w_max_starve
RefParameter.Comment: Num of clocks before starved WPR goes critical

RefParameter.Name: dis_collision_page_opt
RefParameter.Comment: Auto prech disable for flushed command with collision

RefParameter.Name: go2critical_en
RefParameter.Comment: Goes to critical based on urgent signals

RefParameter.Comment: ZQ Control - Impedance divide ratio to ext R

RefParameter.Comment: Byte Lane 0 - RTT ON additive latency

RefParameter.Comment: Byte Lane 0 - DQ dynamic RTT Control

RefParameter.Name: 0sdphase
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter contains the DQS Phase after tuning. Default value is 0.

Please use the DDR Tuning feature of STM32CubeMx DDR Test Suite to get tuned values for your hardware design.

RefParameter.Name: 0mfwdly
RefParameter.Comment: Byte Lane 0 - Master DLL Feedforward trim

RefParameter.Name: POISONCFG
RefParameter.Comment: AXI Poison Configuration Register. Common for all AXI ports (POISONCFG)

Condition.Diagnostic: Width to be set after DDR type is chosen
Available only if DDR3(L) DDR type is set with 16 bits or 32 bits width
Width to be set after DDR type is chosen
Available only if DDR3(L) DDR type is set with 32 bits width
Available only if LPDDR2 or LPDDR3 DDR types are set
